Question: what are the minimum requirements of industrial engineering for masters
Answer: The minimum requirements for the Master's program in Industrial Engineering at UiT The Arctic University of Norway in Narvik include a Bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent in fields such as mechanical, electrical power, electronics, mechatronics, materials science, industrial engineering, process engineering, or other relevant majors. Additionally, applicants should have a minimum of 25 ECTS credits in mathematics (equivalent to Mathematics 1, 2, and 3), 5 ECTS credits in statistics, and 7.5 ECTS credits in physics at a higher level. If applicants lack sufficient mathematics or physics credits, they can take additional courses during the first semester at UiT Narvik to fulfill these requirements.

Question: what facilities are available for students in industrial engineering?

Question: What is the duration of typical subject in the study program ?
Answer: In the Industrial Engineering M.Sc. program at UiT in Narvik, each subject typically lasts for one week in the block-based teaching structure. Each semester consists of two terms of 15 ECTS credits, with a total of six teaching weeks, two self-study weeks, and an exam week. Question: tell me more about Industry X.0
Answer: Industry X.0 refers to the ongoing digital transformation of industrial processes and systems using cutting-edge technologies such as the Internet of Things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), big data analytics, and cloud computing. This transformation aims to create smarter, more connected, and efficient industrial operations that can adapt to changing market demands and drive innovation.  In the Industrial Engineering M.Sc. program at UiT Narvik, the course "Industry X.0" provides students with insights into these advanced technologies and their applications in industrial settings. Students will learn how to leverage Industry X.0 concepts to optimize manufacturing processes, enhance product design, improve supply chain management, and drive overall operational excellence.  For more detailed information on the "Industry X.0" course at UiT Narvik, you can visit the program structure page at: [Industry X.0 Course at UiT Narvik](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3612)

Question: give me the list of courses of this formation
Answer: The courses in the Industrial Engineering M.Sc. program at UiT Narvik are structured as follows:  - **Semester 1 (Autumn):**   - [Quality Management and Improvement](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3600) - 5 credits   - [Robotics and Advanced Manufacturing Systems](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3601) - 5 credits   - Industry X.0 - 5 credits   - [Operations Research 1](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3800) - 5 credits   - [Linear Algebra II](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/MAT-3800) - 5 credits   - [Discrete Mathematics with Game- and Graph Theory](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/MAT-3802) - 5 credits  - **Semester 2 (Spring):**   - [CAD/CAM](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3607) - 5 credits   - [Manufacturing Logistics](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3608) - 5 credits   - [Supply Chain Management](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3609) - 5 credits   - [Computer Integrated Manufacturing](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3610) - 5 credits   - [Digital Twin](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3611) - 5 credits   - [Innovation and Economy](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/TEK-3501) - 5 credits  - **Semester 3 (Autumn):**   - [Thesis - M-IN](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3900) - 45 credits   - [Project - Industrial Engineering](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3602) - 5 credits   - [Operations Research 2](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3606) - 5 credits   - [Innovation and Management](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/TEK-3500) - 5 credits  - **Semester 4 (Spring):**   - [Thesis - M-IN](https://uit.no/utdanning/aktivt/emne/INE-3900) - 45 credits  For more details on each course, you can visit the [UiT Narvik Industrial Engineering M.Sc. page](https://uit.no/utdanning/program/446264/industrial_engineering_-_master).
